title: Kurds Say Turkey Is Shelling Key Syrian Town, Testing Cease-Fire
text:
DUHOK, Iraq—Turkey shelled Ras al-Ain in northeastern Syria in violation of its cease-fire, Kurdish forces said, preventing evacuations from the border town at the center of a fight testing the viability of a pact negotiated with the U.S.

On Saturday, sporadic fire from machine guns, mortars and artillery continued around the besieged town, according to local and foreign activists in the area. In Tal Tamar, a small town south of Ras al-Ain, members of the Kurdish YPG militia were burning tires to obscure visibility for hovering...
description: Turkey is maintaining its siege of Ras al-Ain in northeastern Syria, Kurdish forces said, with the border town at the center of a fight that is testing the cease-fire agreement negotiated by the U.S. and Turkey.
